did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 227 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 4 oversize boxes

did.abstract: Writings, reports, and clippings, relating to the international communist movement and to Jews.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: German and French.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gesamtverband deutscher antikommunistischer Vereinigungen records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms of Material Available
altformavail.p: Entire collection available on microfilm (258 reels).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection of writings, reports, and clippings relating to the international communist movement and to Jews was assembled by the Gesamtverband Deutscher Antikommunistischer Vereinigungen, a German governmental anti-communist and anti-Semitic propaganda agency affiliated with the Reichsministerium f√ºr Volksaufklärung und Propaganda. It was used as an intelligence source on the communist movement worldwide, and provided fuel for the ministry's propaganda campaigns. Most of the material is in German.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in four series: News Clippings, Monitoring Reports, Manuscripts, and Printed Matter and Photographs.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Reichsministerium für Volksaufklärung und Propaganda miscellaneous records, Hoover Institution Archives

item.extref: Downloadable PDF file of the Microfilm Reel Content Guide

scopecontent.p: Clippings from German newspapers and service reports.

arrangement.p:
Arranged alphabetically by name of country, thereunder sometimes arranged by topic. German topical labels found on these files include:
Alle Position (Alle Pos)
Social standing
Kultur (Kul)
Culture
Politik (Pol)
Politics
Rasse
Race
Siedlung (Sied)
Settlement
Ueberblick (Ueberb)
Overview
Verwaltung (Verw)
Administration
Wirtschaft (Wir)
Economics
Zeitung (Zei)
Newspaper
Twenty-eight boxes of unsorted material (boxes 147-171, 173-175), and one box of individually listed manuscripts (box 172), follow the material arranged by country
